tumor_size_max_dimension_evidence: The tumor greatest diameter is 4.7 em as stated in the pathology report.
pT_evidence: The tumor has invaded into peribronchial fatty tissue and the bronchial resection margin is positive for tumor involvement.
pN_evidence: All lymph nodes examined are negative for malignancy, including lobar and interlobar lymph nodes.
tumor_stage_evidence: Based on the estimated pT category (T2) and pN category (N0), the tumor stage is Stage II according to AJCC7 criteria.
histologic_diagnosis_evidence: The pathology report states that the tumor is a squamous cell carcinoma, moderately differentiated.
comment: This lung cancer case is staged as pT2N0 according to AJCC7 criteria. The tumor size is 4.7 cm and has invaded into peribronchial fatty tissue. All lymph nodes examined are negative for malignancy.
